reviews.text:
Loads of planes and helicopters, all really cool. 

Interesting, informative, thought provoking. Focuses on the human side of war in the air as much as the technology. All the better for it.

Currently on display is a collection of art created by students at a local school. Some real talent there.

Cafe, gift shop, plenty of parking, excellent accessibility for less able folk. Easy to find and plenty of parking. Look for the plane by the Mobil petrol station.

Excellent place to visit building is beautifully done spent 3hrs. The tour was informative and fun. Cafe was clean with excellent food. Gift shop had good quality stuff. Will definitely go back when in Christchurch again best place I've been couldn't fault it right done to all the staff. My 16yr old son raved about it.

The museum has historic airplanes in a very good restored condition.
It has a lot of space to walk and sit around, it's very clean including its bathrooms.
The staff is very kind and friendly and they have free tours during the day and the access to the museum is free of charge. Very impressive. We were very glad to luckily have stopped by.

Visit the Air Force Museum it is worth it.  The military aircraft on display are impressive.  Full size aircraft such as a Dakota DC3 and a Spitfire.

The facilities can be hired and significantly sized functions can be held onsite. 

There is a cafeteria and restrooms as well as plenty of car parks usually always available.

The Air Force Museum is a definite go and see place if you haven't been there.

First class museum made sure this was top of my list of places to visit during my time in Christchurch. Not disappointed, be sure to take the tour, guides are great and you get to see behind the scenes, great little cafe and very friendly staff.

This museum is connected to the University - super crowded with students! Our museum guide was very knowledgeable & passionate (I'm told he's a lecturer at the University) about the cultural history of Ethiopia.

Our visit to this museum went smoothly. Our guesthouse host made everything seems seamless!! If you're staying at a guesthouse, take advantage of the service - !!

Provides a rich history and culture of Ethiopia. Itwas a discovery for me to know which community a coffee pot is from by the shape of it. The student guide who accompanied us was very nice in describing the different sections and items if the museum.

The museum itself was great. 100birr per person. However the museum is located within the university, which would have been fine if the guard at the gates didn’t insist on keeping my partner’s ID. Given all we had given him was a driver’s licence. But if we hadn’t brought that along, we would have had to give him a passport. This guard just sits at the gate, not even slightly secure behind a counter, there was no technology to photocopy the ID and he insisted on hanging onto it. I was incredibly unhappy with that and had left a sour taste as we headed in. What was worse was when we decided to let him keep it, we came across a couple foreigners who told us they had taken a cab straight into the University and were not asked to present any ID let alone had to leave it with someone who had no way of securing it. We went back to the guard and demanded our ID back with those foreigners, and he still wouldn’t give it back to us. So, pro tip, if you want to go in, go with a cab, DO NOT walk in unless if you want to risk having your passport taken from you and just left lying around on a chair next to him where anyone could have just taken like we had seen most foreign IDs were when we left.

I would not support the museum for this reason and I urge the university to change their policy. Photocopy the ID if you have to, but foreigners should not be handing in their passport just to enter the university.
Good collection of cultural artifacts. The displays could be better organized and the absence of a good gift shop is a missed opportunity. Worth a visit.
Kind of disappointing but interesting.
Má administração do poder público. Patrimônio histórico, sem seu devido valor por mídias, pelo  governo, total falta de respeito, valorização.
variedade muito grande pra conhecer bastante oisa
Bom para ter lazer
Local de fácil acesso e um clima de paz
.Muito  bom  pra saber istorias de bauru um ótimo lazer

Best place to visit . It is found inside Addis Ababa university , College of natural and computational science compound .
Several wild animals are found reserved ( killed and dried ) 
It has entrance fee 
For regular students (AAU students ) and children - 5 birr
For adult Ethiopians - 15 birr
For foreigners - 100 birr 
If you want to record and take a picture you have to pay another fee .
But all the payments are totally worth it .
I RECOMMEND YOU TO VISIT THIS PLACE .
Museum was closed despite that it's supposed to be opened.  No explanations.  Don't bother going.
It is consist of historical and inspire objects.
Easy to miss. Still worth a walk through for the insect and mammal collections, modest though they are. Gives a sense of the biological  diversity of the country.

Great location. Beautiful, updated rooms with spacious bathrooms. The staff is warm and courteous. Food is delicious. My room had a great view of the city and Bosphorus. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

It's a worthy 5 star hotel in Istanbul. Its price rate is affordable. . Its room is clean and tidy. The check-in staff is quick and friendly. Breakfast is variable and quite good. and The location is convenient to acccess many place inside the city

Excellent clean hotel with an amazing view of the City, really friendly staff. Good sized rooms with all the facitilities you could ask for.

Couple of gripes you can move freely between floors only the level your room is assigned too so we couldn't visit other family members on another floor. Secondly booking via the Turkish Airlines app never received my bonus Miles&Smiles points I emailed the hotel with no reply.

I would probably try another hotel Next time.

If there were ten stars to award, this charming hotel with great elegance would get them all. It is very well located near Taksim square. Some rooms have Bosporus view. The staff is amazing. Each one makes you feel as if you are the only guest in the hotel. The rooms are elegantly furnished  in a  classical style with an Ottoman ambiance. Each room , aside from a comfortable bed, has a leather love seat and a desk. All marble bathroom and the walk in shower are big. Hotel’s three restaurants compete with each other in the sense of the delicious menu they offer. They offer the best examples of the Turkish cuisine in the most delicious way. There is also a Japanese restaurant which is absolutely great. The bar is elegant and romantic with well chosen background music. The hotel houses the company’s nationwide famous patisserie and offers to die for cakes, cookies , chocolates and their own production best of the best Turkish delight. The indoor swimming pool is beautifully designed. There is a Turkish hammam-bath that can be privately booked. The gym is fully equipment and spacious. The hairdressers , two separate shops for men and women, attract local Istanbul clientele as well as hotel guests. It is a pure joy to stay at this hotel and leave yourselves in the hands of a very capable staff who does their job with great care and smile. If l had a choice to stay at some well known hotel chain on the Bosporus and pay four times more and fight Istanbul’s horrendous traffic on the Bosporus  or Divan, my choice would always be for Divan as a person who also stayed at the other ones. Thank you to all Divan staff and its managers.

Thanks for everything.... the staff was so polite and helpful, only 1 things I was angry because I request to have late checking out they tell me after 12 PM they will charge 10 € for per 1hour.  So please change this role. Best Regards,

Went there for a Saturday Buffet date with wife and we had a great evening. The place has nicely set up the ambiance for a romantic dinner date  They serve some really good  food, spread was limited but nicely curated. The desert section was my favorite as it had a lot of variety.

Not at all a great place at that price. Nothing great about ambience or food. Small place actually. Staff service is good and courteous. Less staff. You need to go hotel reception to pay your bill. No ice cream in the desert.
Food is good but limited starters in buffet. ambience was good. If you want have some privacy like closed doors environment I would suggest not to choose monsoon

A descent place to dine-in. Courteous staff and good service.

Food - we tried pizza, pasta and desserts. Pizza was very good but pasta disappointed a bit in terms of taste and quality. The raspberry cheesecake was not good but chocolate bomb was unique.
Ambience - average.
Service - very good staff.

It's been quite some time and we were craving for buffet lunch. After looking for multiple options, we found this to be better than others. This buffet was labelled as fit and healthy so we were also excited for some amazing healthy stuff. Since we reached there just when the buffet started so we thought main course items are yet to be kept. To our greatest surprise there was no main course. So the menu comprised of salads and desserts which is so weird and bizarre. The only main course option was cold burger and cold sandwich which was terrible. Except for khao suey soup and couple of salads n desserts, majority of the offerings were average to below average. The most horrific of all was papadi chaat where the ingredients were papadi and dahi, neither it was healthy nor justified to not put basic ingredients. Healthy doesn't mean non inclusion of basic items. With salads which anyways is an indispensable part of the buffet plus umpteen desserts which has nothing to do with healthiness this buffet was the worse ever experience so far. Coming to their service, it was again not even close to what we expected. The serving folks lacked basic skills in regard to everything. The only sigh of relief was the ambience which was surely in line with what we expected. Overall not suggested in any case!!!
